page.description: The *ARRAY_RANGED_REFERENCE_TO_RANGE() function takes a list of array variable definitions and returns a new list that can be used to properly DIM them.
page.syntax: Variable_List as C = *ARRAY_RANGED_REFERENCE_TO_RANGE( List_of_Variables as C )

argument.name: List_of_Variables
argument.description: A list of variables with maximum array dimensions suitable for DIMming..

page.example: dim vars as C vars = <<%a% arr.row[1].col[3].edited i j arr.row[2].col[1].edited foo[1] arr.row[1].col[2].edited foo[2] arr.row[4].col[5].edited %a% ? *array_ranged_reference_to_range(vars) = arr.row[1..4].col[1..5].edited foo[1..2] i j
